content.title: Revival and Rehabilitation Scheme for Defunct MSMEs and Cashew Processing Units
content.department: Directorate of Industries & Commerce, Government of Kerala
content.beneficiary: Defunct MSMEs and Cashew Processing Units
content.details: The scheme aims to support defunct MSMEs in the manufacturing sector, including cashew processing units, through assistance in the form of capital grants and working capital incentives. It was launched during 2020-21 to address the challenges faced by these units due to various constraints.
benefits: Financial assistance of up to ₹15 Lakhs per applicant unit, available only once.
25% of the total revival project cost for building renovation, limited to ₹2 lakh.
40% of the total revival project cost for plant & machinery and electrification, limited to ₹8 lakh.
50% margin of working capital loan approved by financial institutions, with limits of ₹2 lakhs for defunct MSMEs and ₹5 lakhs for cashew units.
eligibility: All MSMEs in the manufacturing sector which are defunct for at least 6 months due to genuine issues.
Cashew processing enterprises that have the potential to be revived and rehabilitated.
content.application_process: Online application can be submitted through the Official website of the Directorate of Industries & Commerce, Government of Kerala.
documents_required: Copy of Identity proof of applicant
Title deed of land/land tax receipt if applicable
Ownership Certificate of the building if applicable
Registered Lease deed or rent deed in such cases
Invoice/bill/Proof of payment of Plant, machinery and electrification
Valuation of Approved Civil Engineer/ chartered Engineer for civil construction
Sanction order of Bank for Working Capital Loan if any
Audited Balance Sheet for the year before being defunct
Any other document as demanded by the recommending/sanctioning authority

faqs.question: What are the objectives of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to envisage supporting defunct MSMEs in the manufacturing sector including cashew processing units through assistance in the form of capital grants and working capital incentives.

faqs.question: When did this scheme launch?
faqs.answer: The Government of Kerala launched the scheme for defunct MSMEs including cashew processing units during year 2020-21.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Director of Industries & Commerce, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: What does 'Defunct MSME' mean?
faqs.answer: MSMEs which are non-operational for 6 months or more but can be revivable.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹15 Lakhs will be given to an applicant unit.

faqs.question: How many times can an MSME unit avail of the assistance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only once, an MSME unit can avail of assistance under the scheme.
